channel.title: Little Help plz?
channel.description: Hi i am a new coder i have added new models before but i am trying to add pvp items now i can get them all done right but when i go to weild them it makes my character invisible. Does anyone know how to fix this. Btw i am working with a 508 server.

item.title: Little Help plz?
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

Wait, You mean make items from the 508+ cache work in your 317? I didn’t know. Sorry, i thought you meant you MADE PvP armour and it wouldn’t work for some reason. :rolleyes:

[quote=“badger41, post:5, topic:283465”]The most common problem i see is you havent converted from new to old.
this can be done in datmaker with the original mdl file that you get from the jagex cache.

after youve converted here’s how you animate it,
1: If its a platebody go to the anim drop down menu and select the INJECT BLANKS option (make the priorities 10 in the box to the side)
2: If its a pair or platelegs you choose INJECT BLANKS (once again make the priorities 10)
3: If its a helm/full helm you select the head object option (priorities 10)

after this convert the model into .dat
add a model id (ex: 2500 [dont use it though])
get your ints (this is easier than it sounds)
add it server sided (i dont have enough time to tell you how to do this as well)
and it should work
good luck, i hope i helped[/quote]

Yeah do that :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: Little Help plz?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Badger41 is right, the models now stored in the runescape cache are of a different format to the old models, this new format cannot be directly added straight into a 317 client, they need to be converted from new to old first.

Read full topic

item.title: Little Help plz?
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

dont misslead him, the problem might not be the polly count, ive seen pvp armor before and the person who released hadn’t reduced polly count.
I have converted and put full black elite onto my server myself and it needed no editing in meta.
The most common problem i see is you havent converted from new to old.
this can be done in datmaker with the original mdl file that you get from the jagex cache.

after youve converted here’s how you animate it,
1: If its a platebody go to the anim drop down menu and select the INJECT BLANKS option (make the priorities 10 in the box to the side)
2: If its a pair or platelegs you choose INJECT BLANKS (once again make the priorities 10)
3: If its a helm/full helm you select the head object option (priorities 10)

after this convert the model into .dat
add a model id (ex: 2500 [dont use it though])
get your ints (this is easier than it sounds)
add it server sided (i dont have enough time to tell you how to do this as well)
and it should work
good luck, i hope i helped

Read full topic

item.title: Little Help plz?
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

Okay

  1. post a topic titled “[REQ] Need Poly Reduction [REQ]”
  2. Send the volenteer your .mqo of the model
  3. Let him/Her reduce the poly
  4. Let him/her send you the file back
  5. re-do everything you did.

That should just about do it

Read full topic

item.title: Little Help plz?
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

i think you have an extremely high poly count on the item. If it is above about 2.5k then it may make your character invisible. Lower the poly count and try again.

Reduce the amount of faces

Read full topic
